node.title: ‘Her touch, her kiss’: A couple reunites as the U.S. reopens to vaccinated travelers.
node.alt: Nirmit Shelat, 31, (left) hugs his girlfriend, Jolly Dave, 30, (right) after she arrived from India at Newark Liberty International Airport on Monday.
node.description: Romantic partners and families rejoiced as they met in airports after long months of separation because of pandemic travel restrictions.
node.content: ["As the United States reopened to fully vaccinated travelers from dozens of countries on Monday, it was a morning of joyous reunions, some hard-earned.", "Jolly Dave\u2019s odyssey started last weekend, with a seven-hour bus ride from the Indian city of Gujarat to Mumbai. There she took a three-hour flight to New Delhi, then boarded a 16-hour flight to Newark.", "Ms. Dave, 30, was traveling to meet her boyfriend, Nirmit Shelat, 31, whom she had not seen since last winter, when she had returned to their home city of Gujarat, expecting to stay for a few months. But then India experienced a devastating coronavirus surge, and her travel was restricted.", "Mr. Nirmit, a project manager at Bank of America, had stayed in the United States. When the United States finally lifted its restrictions on travelers from India, Mr. Nirmit went online, booked an Air India flight for Ms. Dave and paid $1,700 for the one-way ticket from New Delhi to Newark\u2019s Liberty International Airport.", "On Sunday night, Mr. Nirmit drove 600 miles north to New Jersey from their home in Charlotte, N.C., checked into an Airbnb in Freehold, N.J., at 6:30 a.m. and then headed to Newark\u2019s Terminal B to greet Ms. Dave.", "\u201cMy Lady Luck is back,\u201d he said as he waited. \u201cYou can make daily calls, stay connected by FaceTime, but you want to experience her fingers, her touch, her kiss. She told me she wants to break the Apple wall.\u201d", "They saw each other from down a hallway, and embraced upon reuniting. She kept her mask on as they kissed. He grew emotional. She was carrying three roller suitcases and four bags.", "\u201cThe Apple wall is broken,\u201d she said.", "At Miami International Airport, Natalia Vitorini, a 28-year-old student living in Miami, waited on Concourse D for her parents to get off the morning\u2019s first flight from S\u00e3o Paulo, Brazil. She had her 3-week-old son in a stroller.", "Her mother, Debora Vitorini, 56, who works in the biomedical industry in S\u00e3o Paulo, bought her ticket within hours of the announcement of the reopening date. She and her husband, Sergio, arrived a little after 6 a.m.", "The last time they had seen each other was in March 2020. Natalia Vitorini got pregnant earlier this year, and gave birth to her son a few weeks ago. \u201cI was waiting for the border to open so my mom can come to see my baby,\u201d she said."]
